article.headline: Fordham 77, St. Louis 68
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Marcus Stout and Chris Bethel each had 16 points to lead five double-figure scorers as Fordham won its third straight conference game, a 77-68 victory Saturday over St. Louis. Sebastian Greene and Bryant Dunston added 12 points each for the Rams (11-7, 4-2 Atlantic 10), and Brenton Butler had 11. Tommie Liddell scored 22 points for the Billikens (12-7, 2-4). Ian Vouyoukas, who shot 8-for-13, had 18 points. Stout committed a pair of fouls 2 minutes into the game, but returned to connect on a pair of 3-pointers to spark a 13-7 first-half run that gave Fordham a 33-23 lead with less than 4 minutes remaining before halftime. Vouyoukas had eight points as the Billikens opened the second half with an 11-6 run to forge a 41-41 tie, but Fordham then surged to a 62-51 lead with less than 9 minutes remaining. St. Louis never got closer than seven points the rest of the way.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
